subject: Self Care
title: Reduced Productivity
description: A fast breakdown of Reduced Productivity for builders.

hook.text: Tasks that took one hour now take three. You stare at the screen, start over, forget mid-sentence. The brain is offline.

buildup.text: Burnout impairs executive function: planning, focusing, decision-making, and working memory all decline.

discovery.text: The cruel irony: reduced productivity makes you work longer to compensate, which deepens the burnout further.

twist.text: Working harder when burned out doesn't help. It's like running a car engine on empty â€” more gas won't help without fuel.

climax.text: If output is dropping despite maximum effort, the answer is rest and recovery â€” not more hours at the desk.

punchline.text: Declining output despite more effort signals burnout, not laziness.

quiz.question: Why does working harder during burnout make things worse?
options: More effort without recovery deepens the exhaustion cycle
